text: Q.13 Consider a new sorting algorithm similar to the bubble sort algorithm, called RumbleSort. Given an array as input, RumbleSort attempts to sort the array and produces a sorted array as output.Hereâ€™s the pseudocode for RumbleSort. RumbleSort(L): let sorted = false while not sorted: sorted = true fori:=0;i<len(L) -2; i++: if L[i] > L[i + 2] sorted = false reverse the given list from L[i] to L[i + 2] (inclusive) Consider running RumbleSort on the following inputs. For which of the inputs given below, does RumbleSort produce the correct sorted array? @ [56843] Correct Option e [56483] o [34865] Your option is Correct Q [54863] Correct Option VIEW Anwser || COPY || MARK
